questions: Define the term poikilotherms.
answers: The cold blooded animals which change their body temperature according to the surroundings (do not possess a constant body temperature) are known as poikilotherms. They are also called cold blooded or ectothermic animals.

questions: What are radiata ?
answers: Radiata are animals having radial symmetry of their bodies.

questions: What is open type circulatory system ?
answers: A circulatory system in which the blood is not confined into blood vessels and bathes the cells as well as tissues is known as open type circulatory system.

questions: Write a technical term for an animal having true body cavity.
answers: Coelomate are animals having true body cavity.

questions: What are bilateria ?
answers: Animals with bilateral symmetry are called bilateria.

questions: What is metamerism?
answers: In some animals the body is externally and internally divided into segments with a serial repetition of at least some organs E.g. Earthworm, Neries etc.

questions: Name the special cells characteristics of coelenterates.
answers: Nematoblast or nematocysts.

questions: Name a sanguivorous annelid.
answers: Hirudinaria ganulosa (Cattle leech).

questions: What organs do echinoderms have for respiration and locomotion ?
answers: Dermal branchiae for respiration and tube feet for locomotion.

questions: Which sponge is used as a marriage gift?
answers: An anti-coagulant hirudin from salivary glands of leech.

questions: Name the toxin found in the cnidoblast of coelenterates.
answers: The toxin is hypnotoxin.

questions: Name the larva found in mollusca and annelids.
answers: Trochophore larva.

questions: What do you understand by hermaphrodite ?
answers: Animals having both male and female reproductive organs in a single individual are called hermaphrodite.

questions: What is polymorphism ?
answers: The phenomenon where an organism have different kinds of zooids for different functions is called polymorphism e.g., cnidarians.

questions: What are benthos ?
answers: Animals that live at the bottom of sea, oceans and lakes are called benthos. E.g., echinoderms.

questions: What are worm castings ?
answers: Compacted pellets of faeces of earthworm laid as heaps are called worm castings.

questions: What is mantle ?
answers: Mantle is a membranous projection of bodv whose edge secretes a shell of calcium carbonate to form a covering of body wall.

questions: Name the type of mouth part found in Cockroach and Mosquito.
answers: (i) Cockroach - Biting and chewing type. (ii) Mosquito - Piercing and sucking type. ½ + ½

questions: What are choanocytes ?
answers: Collar cells that lines spongocoel and other canals in sponges, are called choanocytes.

questions: what are flame cells ?
answers: Flame cells are the excretory organs of Platyhelminthes and related animals which possess flickering cilia or flagella for driving the excretory products.

questions: What is radula ?
answers: Radula is a teeth like structure found in the buccal cavity of snail.

questions: Why do parasitic tapeworms not have digestive tracts ?
answers: parasitic tapeworm lacks alimentary canal because the digested food of the host is diffused directly through the general body surface.

questions: What are green glands ?
answers: Excretory organs of phylum Arthropoda are called green glands.

questions: Name two adaptations for an aerial mode of life.
answers: (i) Fore legs modified into wings. (ii) Uricotelic excretion and pneumatic bone. e.g., bird, crow, sparrow etc.

questions: Why do the fishes belonging to class chondrichthyes have to swim constantly?
answers: Air bladder is absent in these fishes therefore, they have to swim constantly to avoid sinking.

questions: Name the two classes of vertebrates whose heart is four – chambered?
answers: Aves and Mammalia.

questions: What unique features do mammals possess?
answers: The unique features of mammals are presence of mammary glands and hairs on the skin.

questions: Give an example of urochordata and cephalochordata ?
answers: Doliolum and Branchiostoma.

questions: What is the function of lateral line sense organs in fishes?
answers: The lateral line sense organs in fishes helps in detection of current and waves in water.

questions: Define pneumatic bones.
answers: A bone that is hollow or contains many air cells.

questions: Give one difference between cartilaginous and bony fishes.
answers: In cartilaginous fishes endoskeleton is made up of cartilages, while in bony fishes it is made up of bones.

questions: What is aestivation ?
answers: Aestivation is a state of animal dormancy characterized by inactivity and a lowered metabolic rate, in response to high temperature and arid conditions.

questions: Name a fish which has lungs in addition to gills.
answers: Protopterus commonly called as lung fish.

questions: What is the sound producing organs of the birds ?
answers: Syrinx is the sound producing organs of the birds.

questions: Name two flightless birds.
answers: Ostrich, Emu, Kiwi and Penguin.  (Any two)

questions: What is notochord?
answers: Notochord is a solid, cylindrical, rod like structure formed of vacuolated cells present in the mid dorsal body axis of the chordates.

questions: Name two division of vertebrata.
answers: (i) Agatha  (ii) Gnathostomata

questions: Name any two poisonous snake.
answers: Cobra and Krait.

questions: Distinguish between Viviparous and Oviparous animals.
answers: Viviparous are animals which give birth to young ones of their own kind. e.g., Mammals. Oviparous are animals which lay eggs e.g., Reptiles, birds etc.
